item.title: Automated Tracing
item.description: Integrating Yor into your CI pipeline. In the same way as Checkov can be used for both a quick local scan or automated as part of your CI pipeline, Yor is designed to do the same. The following simple Github action will run Yor, auto-committing new tags on changed resources name: yor on: - push - pull_request jobs: add-your-tags: runs-on: ubuntu-latest strategy: matrix: python-version: [3.7] steps: - name: Checkout repo uses: actions/checkout@v2 with: fetch-depth: 0 - name: Run yor action uses: bridgecrewio/yor-action@main Lets take a look at this in action:

item.title: Using Yor Tracing
item.description: Using Yor traces in runtime Easily find Cloud Resources based on git information Once our resources are deployed, we now have multiple ways to find, link and correlate between the who and what of our IaC actions in git, and the real resources running in our cloud environment. For example, we can use the bridgecrew dashboard resource explorer, to query for all runtime resources in our AWS account which were last modified by matt-at-bridgecrew.
